headline: End of session passed flurry of health bills
sentences: Also passed during this session was a bill increasing lead poisoning protections and enforcement for children, something state regulators have identified as an extensive problem in Georgia.
Georgias healthcare industry is set to see several big changes this year, thanks to a number of health bills passed during the final hours of this years legislative session.
Backers of that bill expanding Medicaid from six months to a full year say it will help improve the states epidemic of maternal mortality and race-based health disparities.
Georgia health advocates are also celebrating the passage of a proposal that funds more Medicaid coverage for postpartum women.
It forces insurance companies to treat mental health conditions on par with physical ones.
Among the proposals up for debate was the Mental Health Parity Act.
Brian Kemp signed it into law earlier this week.
